channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hurricane Katrina was a catalyst for change in New Orleans' public defender office
item.description: Hurricane Katrina exposed longstanding flaws in the New Orleans criminal justice system. In the 20 years since, there has been dramatic change in the ...

item.title: Tennessee Inmate to Be Executed Despite Ethical Health Concerns
item.description: Lawyers for Byron Black, found guilty of three murders, have argued that an execution may be more painful because of his heart implant.

item.title: On Gaza, Germany’s Government Faces Pressure from All Sides
item.description: Germany, after the Holocaust, has a special bond with Israel. But a hunger crisis in Gaza is creating a demand for Berlin to take bolder action.

item.title: As ceasefire talks stall, Israel's government weighs a full occupation of Gaza

item.title: Mahmoud Khalil Tells His Story
item.description: The Palestinian activist discusses the Columbia protests, ICE detention and free speech in America.

item.title: He said, she said, it said: I used ChatGPT as a couple's counselor. How did we fare?
item.description: Looking for backup, I turned to an AI chatbot for relationship wisdom. It took my side. It was only when I challenged the bot's biases — and my own — ...

item.title: This Tuscan startup sold all its olive oil in the U.S. Then came Trump's tariffs
item.description: Americans love olive oil — and import 95% of it. But tariffs are making it harder for Europeans to sell it to Americans.

item.title: Record-Breaking Rain Pounds Hong Kong
item.description: Stairways have turned into waterfalls as torrential rain has battered the island for more than a week.

item.title: Bite Club: The Fraternity That Awaits You After a Shark Attack
item.description: Very few people know what it’s like to recover, physically and emotionally, from a shark bite. But some of the ones who do are ready to help.
